intro: Cyphostemma robynsii, commonly known as the desert milk vine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds, and is characterized by its tendrils and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by orange or red berries. It is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system to access water. Its latex is toxic, making it important to handle with care.
